item.description:
April's event will be a SUNDAY Meetup.

This month's topic: Writing code and writing words--Compare and contrast.

This is inspired by a comment John made in January. Is there a connection between programming computers and writing a story? There do seem to be several SF writers who have come from the various realms of IT.

On the one hand, the structure necessary to write a good story is like the structure necessary for a computer program; you must lay out the steps needed to solve a problem. On the other, you can never leave a computer program in a non-functioning state; whereas once you have a story in working order, you feel like you've found gold.

Challenge: If you've ever done any programming, does it feel like writing to you?
If you haven't, is there anything else you do that puts you into a similar state of mind?

Agenda:

4:00 Names.

Topic: Writing code and writing words--Compare and contrast.

5:00 Break
Open Discussion

6:00 Go Home and Write!
